Package com.nickbenn.onehundred.controller

Class CommandLineOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nickbenn.onehundred.controller.CommandLineOptions
  • public class CommandLineOptions
extends Object
    Defines several position-independent command-line options, along with the parse(String[]) method for populating corresponding fields from the command line at runtime, and accessor methods to interrogate the resulting option values. The options defined include one (--help or -?) which is used to display a usage information/help screen.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CommandLineOptions()
      Initialize this instance by defining the various options to be recognized by parse(String[]).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getBound()
      Returns the target value (for the addition game) or the starting value (for the subtraction game).
      int getMaxMove()
      Returns the maximum value that can be added (for the addition game) or subtracted (for the subtraction game).
      Game.Operation getOperation()
      Returns the game operation or direction (that is, addition or subtraction) as an instance of the Game.Operation enum.
      Strategy getStrategy()
      Returns a key identifying the playing Strategy used by the computer.
      boolean isHelpRequested()
      Indicates that the --help or -? option was passed to parse(String[]) in args.
      void parse​(String[] args)
      Parses the specified String[] (presumably containing the command-line arguments passed to the applications entry-point main method).
      void showHelp()
      Displays the usage syntax and list of available options, with short descriptions of (and default values for) each.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandLineOptions

        public CommandLineOptions()
        Initialize this instance by defining the various options to be recognized by parse(String[]).

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse​(String[] args)
           throws org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException,
                  Strategy.StrategyInitializationException,
                  IllegalArgumentException
        Parses the specified String[] (presumably containing the command-line arguments passed to the applications entry-point main method). If a given option is not present in args, the relevant default value (specified as a constant in the Game class) will be used.
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.cli.ParseException - If the command-line arguments are not recognized as specifying the options defined here.
        Strategy.StrategyInitializationException - If the specified (or default) Strategy cannot be instantiated.
        IllegalArgumentException - If any of the option values cannot be parsed from the String representation used in the command line to the appropriate type.

      • showHelp

        public void showHelp()
        Displays the usage syntax and list of available options, with short descriptions of (and default values for) each.

      • getBound

        public int getBound()
        Returns the target value (for the addition game) or the starting value (for the subtraction game). This value is taken either from the args passed to the parse(String[]) method, or from the default value specified in Game.DEFAULT_UPPER_BOUND.
        Returns:
        (See above.)

      • getMaxMove

        public int getMaxMove()
        Returns the maximum value that can be added (for the addition game) or subtracted (for the subtraction game). This value is taken either from the args passed to the parse(String[]) method, or from the default value specified in Game.DEFAULT_MAX_MOVE.
        Returns:
        (See above.)

      • getOperation

        public Game.Operation getOperation()
        Returns the game operation or direction (that is, addition or subtraction) as an instance of the Game.Operation enum. This value is taken either from the args passed to the parse(String[]) method, or from the default value specified in Game.DEFAULT_OPERATION.
        Returns:
        (See above.)

      • getStrategy

        public Strategy getStrategy()
        Returns a key identifying the playing Strategy used by the computer. This value is taken either from the args passed to the parse(String[]) method, or from the default value specified in ConsoleSolitaireReferee.DEFAULT_STRATEGY_KEY.
        Returns:
        (See above.)

      • isHelpRequested

        public boolean isHelpRequested()
        Indicates that the --help or -? option was passed to parse(String[]) in args. This flag is used to display a usage information/help screen instead of starting a game.
        Returns:
        (See above.)
